Your father simply overpowers you by saying, "Don't talk to me in that tone of voice, young man." The discussion ends in a shouting match. You both think you get the last word.
Your dad is taken aback by your assertiveness and is forced to examine his own behavior.
He realizes that he has been unfair to you and apologizes. The two of you gain a mutual respect for one another.

Unfortunately, he is stubborn. Even though he feels you are right, deep down inside he doesn't have the courage to admit that he is wrong. He believes it is a sign of weakness to admit that he is wrong in front of someone in his family.
This must be very frustrating for you.
